Class PhysicsVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • PhysicsVector

  • public class PhysicsVector
extends java.lang.Object
    A 3-dimensional vector class to be used in the development of computer simulations of various physical systems. The 3-dimensional vector represents a standard cartesian vector given by xi + yj +zk where i, j, and k are unit vectors in the x, y, and z direction respectively.
    Version:
    1.4
    Author:
    Iain A. Bertram, Harry Baker

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PhysicsVector​()
      Default constructor that creates a PhysicsVector with zero magnitude
      PhysicsVector​(double[] x)
      Constructor that takes an array of length 3 and sets the components of the vector to the values stored in the array.
      PhysicsVector​(double x, double y)
      Constructor that takes two arguments to create a PhysicsVector with the first argument x giving the component in the i direction and the second argument y giving the component in the j direction.
      PhysicsVector​(double x, double y, double z)
      Constructor that takes three arguments to create a PhysicsVector with the first argumentgiving the component in the i direction, the second argument giving the component in the j direction and the third argument giving the component in the k direction.
      PhysicsVector​(PhysicsVector v)
      Constructor that creates a vector with the same value as the PhysicsVector passed as an argument.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PhysicsVector

        public PhysicsVector​()
        Default constructor that creates a PhysicsVector with zero magnitude

      • PhysicsVector

        public PhysicsVector​(double x,
                     double y)
        Constructor that takes two arguments to create a PhysicsVector with the first argument x giving the component in the i direction and the second argument y giving the component in the j direction. The z component is set to zero.
        Parameters:
        x - Double to be set to x-component of vector
        y - Double to be set to y-component of vector

      • PhysicsVector

        public PhysicsVector​(double x,
                     double y,
                     double z)
        Constructor that takes three arguments to create a PhysicsVector with the first argumentgiving the component in the i direction, the second argument giving the component in the j direction and the third argument giving the component in the k direction.
        Parameters:
        x - Double to be set to x-component of vector
        y - Double to be set to y-component of vector
        z - Double to be set to z-component of vector

      • PhysicsVector

        public PhysicsVector​(double[] x)
        Constructor that takes an array of length 3 and sets the components of the vector to the values stored in the array. If array length = 2 it sets the x and y components. Returns a default vector if the array is not length 2 or 3 and prints a warning message.
        Parameters:
        x - Array to be converted to a PhysicsVector

      • PhysicsVector

        public PhysicsVector​(PhysicsVector v)
        Constructor that creates a vector with the same value as the PhysicsVector passed as an argument.
        Parameters:
        v - PhysicsVector to be copied

    • Method Detail

      • return2DString

        public java.lang.String return2DString​()
        Method to return a String which represents the vector and has the form xi + yj.
        Returns:
        String xi + yj

      • returnSimple2DString

        public java.lang.String returnSimple2DString​()
        Method to return a String which represents the vector and has the form x y (I.e. separated with spaces).
        Returns:
        String x y

      • returnString

        public java.lang.String returnString​()
        Method to return a String which represents the vector and has the form xi + yj +zk.
        Returns:
        String xi + yj + zk

      • returnSimpleString

        public java.lang.String returnSimpleString​()
        Method to return a String which represents the vector and has the form x y z (I.e. only separated by spaces).
        Returns:
        String "x y z"

      • print2D

        public void print2D​()
        Prints the vector to 'standard out'. Note: it will include a carriage return. Prints: xi + yj

      • print

        public void print​()
        Prints the vector to 'standard out'. Note: it will include a carriage return. Prints: xi + yj + zk

      • setVector

        public void setVector​(double x,
                      double y,
                      double z)
        Change the value of the vector to xi + yj + zk
        Parameters:
        x - x-component of the vector
        y - y-component of the vector
        z - z-component of the vector

      • setVector

        public void setVector​(double x,
                      double y)
        Change the value of the vector to xi + yj. The z-component is set to zero.
        Parameters:
        x - x-component of the vector
        y - y-component of the vector

      • setVector

        public void setVector​(PhysicsVector v)
        Modify the vector so that it is equal to vector v
        Parameters:
        v - the vector that is then used to set the values of the modified vector.

      • increaseBy

        public void increaseBy​(PhysicsVector v)
        Add a vector v to the original vector. Normal vector addition is carried out. I.e. the x-components are added and the y components are added, etc.
        Parameters:
        v - vector to be added to original vector.

      • decreaseBy

        public void decreaseBy​(PhysicsVector v)
        Subtract a vector v from the original vector. Normal vector addition is carried out. I.e. the x-components are subtracted and the y components are subtracted, etc.
        Parameters:
        v - Vector to be subtracted from the original vector.

      • magnitude

        public double magnitude​()
        Returns the magnitude of the vector. If the vector is given by xi +yj +zk Then the magnitude is Math.sqrt(x*x + y*y + zz)
        Returns:
        A scalar with the magnitude

      • getX

        public double getX​()
        return the x-component of the vector
        Returns:
        x-component

      • getY

        public double getY​()
        return the y-component of the vector
        Returns:
        y-component#

      • getZ

        public double getZ​()
        return the z-component of the vector
        Returns:
        z-component

      • getUnitVector

        public PhysicsVector getUnitVector​()
        Returns a vector with magnitude of one and the origibal direction of the original vector. I.e. scale the vector by 1/magnitude. If vector is a zero vector then returns zero length vector
        Returns:
        unit vector with direction of original vector

      • scale

        public void scale​(double x)
        scale the components of the vector by the scalar. I.e. If the scalar is s then the vector transfoms to s*xComponent i + s*yComponent j.
        Parameters:
        x - the factor to scale the vector by.

      • scale

        public static PhysicsVector scale​(double x,
                                  PhysicsVector v)
        Scale the components of the vector by a scalar. I.e. If the scalar is s then the vector transfoms to s*xComponent i + s*yComponent j.
        Parameters:
        x - The factor to scale the vector by.
        v - The vector to scale
        Returns:
        The scaled vector

      • dot

        public static double dot​(PhysicsVector v,
                         PhysicsVector u)
        Dot is a standard vector scalar product. If v = xi + yj and u = wi + zy, then the dot product returns xw + yz
        Parameters:
        v - first vector in product
        u - second vector in product
        Returns:
        return scalar product

      • vectorProduct

        public static PhysicsVector vectorProduct​(PhysicsVector v,
                                          PhysicsVector u)
        vectorProduct is a standard 3D vector product.
        Parameters:
        v - first vector in cross product
        u - second vector in cross product
        Returns:
        return vector product

      • add

        public static PhysicsVector add​(PhysicsVector v,
                                PhysicsVector u)
        standard vector addition. If v = xi + yj and u = wi + zy, then the method returns a vector (x+w)i + (y+z)j
        Parameters:
        v - first vector in sum
        u - second vector in sum
        Returns:
        return summed vector

      • subtract

        public static PhysicsVector subtract​(PhysicsVector v,
                                     PhysicsVector u)
        vector subtraction. If v = xi + yj and u = wi + zy, then the vector returned is (x-w)i + (y-z)j
        Parameters:
        v - first vector in sum
        u - second vector in sum
        Returns:
        return resultant vector
